title: How to Use Printables on iPad (GoodNotes/Notability)
description: Learn how to transition from paper to digital planning by using our PDF templates on your iPad.
body:
## The Ultimate Guide to Digital Planning on iPad

Transitioning from physical paper to digital planning is a game-changer. It offers the best of both worlds: the tactile feel of handwriting combined with the powerful organization of digital tools.

### Step-by-Step Setup
1. **Download the PNG:** For best results on iPad, use the PNG image version of our templates.
2. **Import to GoodNotes:** Open GoodNotes, create a new notebook, and 'Import' the PNG as a page.
3. **Use the Apple Pencil:** The PNG transparency allows you to write 'on' the template just like paper.
4. **Duplicate Pages:** Once you've filled a sheet, just swipe left to create a carbon-copy blank for the next day.

title: How to Print Without Margins (A4/Letter)
description: Stop wasting space! Learn the exact printer settings to get beautiful, full-page prints of your templates.
body:
## Stop the White Border: A Guide to Borderless Printing

There's nothing more frustrating than a beautiful template being shrunk by 'printer margins.' Here is how to fix it on Windows and Mac.

### Core Settings
1. **Scale:** Always set to '100%' or 'Actual Size.' Never choose 'Fit to Page' unless the template is larger than your paper.
2. **Borderless Setting:** If your printer supports it, find the 'Borderless Printing' checkbox in 'Advanced Properties.'
3. **Orientation:** Our templates specify Portrait or Landscape in the title. Ensure your printer matches.

title: How to Build a Cleaning Schedule That Sticks
description: Stop the cycle of marathon cleaning. Learn the psychological tricks to stay consistent with your chores.
body:
## Consistency Over Intensity: The Secret to a Clean Home

The reason most cleaning routines fail is because they are too ambitious. This guide shows you how to build a cycle that works with your life.

### The 3-Tier System
1. **Non-Negotiables:** 3 tasks (e.g., dishes, trash) that must be done daily to prevent chaos.
2. **Weekly Sprints:** 1 area of the house per day (Kitchen on Monday, Bathrooms on Tuesday).
3. **Monthly Resets:** Deep tasks like baseboards or air filters.

title: Time Blocking for Beginners
description: Reclaim your schedule by assigning every hour a specific task. A simple guide to the most popular productivity method.
body:
## From To-Do Lists to Time Blocks

To-do lists are just 'wishes.' Time blocks are 'commitments.' By assigning a task to a specific time, you reduce the decision fatigue that leads to procrastination.

### How to Start
1. **Large Blocks first:** Put your classes, meetings, and fixed appointments into the grid.
2. **Deep Work:** Assign 90-minute blocks for your most difficult project in the AM.
3. **Batch Trivialities:** Put all your emails, calls, and admin into one 1-hour block.
4. **The Buffer:** Always leave 30 minutes of 'blank space' for the small fires that inevitably happen.

title: Weekly Review Method (Simple)
description: The 20-minute habit that will save you 10 hours of stress every week. A step-by-step guide to the perfect Sunday reset.
body:
## The 20-Minute Sunday Reset

The Weekly Review is a systematic way to clear your head and prepare for Monday.

### The Checklist
1. **Desktop Clear:** Physically and digitally clear your workspace.
2. **Calendar Audit:** Look at the coming two weeks. Any birthdays? Appointments?
3. **Task Scan:** Look at your 'Done' tasks from last week. What didn't get finished?
4. **Top 3:** Identify the three outcomes that will make next week a SUCCESS.

title: Habit Stacking 101: The Secret to Transformation
description: Learn the most powerful habit-forming technique used by high-performers.
body:
## Stop Relying on Willpower: Habit Stacking

Habit Stacking is the process of attaching a new habit to an existing one. 'After [Current Habit], I will [New Habit].'

### Examples
- After I pour my coffee, I will write my **Top 3 Priorities** for the day.
- After I put my kids to bed, I will do my **10-minute Brain Dump**.
- After I finish dinner, I will check off my **Cleaning Checklist**.

title: Managing Digital Clutter: A 3-Day Reset
description: Reclaim your focus with this step-by-step digital declutter.
body:
## The Silent Distraction: Digital Declutter

Digital clutter is invisible but draining. Use this 3-day plan to reset your tech.

### The Plan
- **Day 1: The Phone.** Delete unused apps, clear notifications, and move social icons off the home screen.
- **Day 2: The Desktop.** Clear your computer desktop. Organize files into a 'year/month' folder system.
- **Day 3: The Inbox.** Unsubscribe from 10 newsletters you no longer read. Archiving is your best friend.

title: The Pomodoro Technique for Students
description: Stop procrastinating and start studying. A deep dive into the 25-minute focus method.
body:
## Work with Time, Not Against It: Pomodoro

The Pomodoro Technique uses a timer to break work into intervals, traditionally 25 minutes long, separated by short breaks.

### Why it Works
- **The Finish Line:** You can stay focused on anything for just 25 minutes.
- **Anti-Burnout:** The 5-minute break allows your brain to 'diffuse' the information you just learned.
- **Parkinson's Law:** The ticking timer creates a gentle sense of urgency that speeds up your work.
